> > Why is SC2001 disabled?
> 
> It isn't, but it seems that it didn't pick up our mistake and assumed `%` was part of the pattern
> 
> @hebasto We need to fix the rest of them too... [17f81e9#diff-43ab305e977a53cc028bfb0eaaacf989](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/17f81e96486780df5d464487975ecb11b278ec8d#diff-43ab305e977a53cc028bfb0eaaacf989)

The rest are ok.  `.` is a specia

> Currently the gitian-win-signer.yml produces OUTFILE names without -unsigned stripped out\n\nWhen was this problem introduced? On releases, this renaming definitely works and a filename without `-unsigned` is produced.

> > Currently the gitian-win-signer.yml produces OUTFILE names without -unsigned stripped out
> 
> When was this problem introduced? On releases, this renaming definitely works and a filename without `-unsigned` is produced.

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17361 8 days ago. There's gitian builds in PR but did not include codesigned gitian builds

> #17361 8 days ago. There's gitian builds in PR but did not include codesigned gitian builds

Sorry for introducing a bug.

@willyko Thank you for fixing!

From [bash docs](https://www.gnu.org/savannah-checkouts/gnu/bash/manual/bash.html#Shell-Parameter-Expansion):

> **_${parameter/pattern/string}_**
>
> The _pattern_ is expanded to produce a pattern just as in filename expan
